questions.text: What is an app shell model

options.text: An iterator is an object which defines a sequence and a return value upon its termination
options.description: This is unrelated to App Shell models.

options.text: A callback function is a function passed into another function as an argument
options.description: This defines a callback, not an App Shell.

options.text: An application shell (or app shell) architecture is one way to build a Progressive Web App that reliably and instantly loads on your users' screens, similar to what you see in native applications
options.description: Correct! The App Shell architecture is a design pattern for building PWAs.

questions.explanation:
An application shell (or app shell) architecture is one way to build a Progressive Web App that reliably and instantly loads on your users' screens, similar to what you see in native applications. It is useful for getting some initial HTML to the screen fast without a network.

141.
